intro: Arracacia schiedei, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, although it can become invasive in certain regions.
